intro: Parasenecio mortonii, commonly known as the Morton's parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-green in color. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
